articles.title: Actor Haley Joel Osment Charged With Public Intoxication, Cocaine Possession
articles.summary: Haley Joel Osment was arrested on April 8 at Mammoth Mountain on suspicion of being under the influence of alcohol in public and possession of cocaine. He is scheduled to be arraigned on July 7 in the Mammoth Lakes branch of Mono County Superior Court. Osment rose to international fame as a child actor, starring alongside Bruce Willis in 'The Sixth Sense' and 'A.I. Artificial Intelligence.' He was among thousands who lost their homes in the devastating Eaton Fire in the Altadena area near Los Angeles this year.

articles.title: Microsoft Copilot shows up even when it's not wanted
articles.author: Thomas Claburn
articles.summary: Microsoft's Copilot AI service sometimes ignores commands to disable it and turns itself back on. A bug report to the Visual Studio Code, aka VS Code, Copilot repository from developer Rektbuildr claims it enabled itself within various VS Code workspaces on its own.

articles.title: Thread by @bewaterltd on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: There is a seductive idea that AGI + Big Data + Supercompute = Perfectly Planned Economy. It's wrong and economically suicidal. The most important economic knowledge is uncodifiable and cannot be manipulated by AI. Prices are humanity's most sophisticated information system and processor.

articles.title: Head of Google Search discloses AI Overviews' secrets in interview
articles.author: Jean Leon
articles.summary: The head of Google Search, Elizabeth Reid, was interviewed by Melissa HeikkilÃ¤ of the Financial Times. She talked about the introduction of the AI-powered overviews in Google Search. She also addressed some controversial topics, such as the accuracy of AI results and the negative impact on traffic and revenue.

articles.title: Fake job seekers are flooding the market, thanks to AI
articles.author: Kara Fellows
articles.summary: Scammers are using artificial intelligence to create fake profiles to apply for remote job postings. Vidoc Security co-founder Dawid Moczadlo had an AI-generated interview with a fake job seeker. He ended the interview because the software the scammer was using didn't seem sophisticated. The company hired the fake employee for a one-day in-person interview.

articles.title: Elderly Stop & Shop cashier stays forever young behind the register
articles.author: Sarah Bawden
articles.summary: Pauline Volpi has been working at the Stop & Shop in Cranston for the past 40 years. She wears thick-rimmed glasses on the job, but she doesn't need them. She will be 89 years old this summer. Volpi's secret to living a long and happy life is to pray a lot and go to the doctors.

articles.title: Gemini 2.5 Pro, Google's most powerful AI, is available to students for free
articles.summary: Google is making Gemini Advanced available for free to students. It includes access to the newly released Gemini 2.5 Pro model and 2TB of storage. The offer extends through Spring 2026 as long as you subscribe by the end of June. If you already have a paid Gemini subscription, you can switch to the free offer.

articles.title: MUSC hosts first annual AI global hackathon event
articles.author: P.J. Williams
articles.summary: The Medical University of South Carolina hosted its first annual artificial intelligence global hackathon in downtown Charleston. The event seeks to develop AI programming to improve healthcare workflow and processes. Day 1 included Interactive Flow Builder certification and AI 101 sessions, hands-on exercises with AI tools and team-based ideation workshops. Day 2 included teams building workflow automations with Notable engineers using test data and final 'Shark Tank-style' pitch presentations to the MUSC judging panel.

articles.title: OpenAI's new reasoning AI models hallucinate more
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: OpenAI's new AI models, o3 and o4-mini, hallucinate more often than the company's previous AI models. The company doesn't know why it's happening. O3 hallucinated in response to 33% of questions on PersonQA, which is twice the rate of previous reasoning models. Transluce, a nonprofit AI research lab, found evidence that o3 has a tendency to make up actions it took in the process of arriving at answers.

articles.title: OpenAI's new reasoning AI models hallucinate more
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.summary: OpenAI's new AI models, o3 and o4-mini, hallucinate more often than their older models. The company doesn't know why it's happening, but it's working to improve their accuracy and reliability. The industry has been focusing on reasoning models in the last year.

articles.title: Better Artificial Intelligence Stock: IonQ vs. Palantir Technologies
articles.author: Justin Pope
articles.summary: IonQ (NYSE: IONQ) and Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) have both made big returns in the last two years. IonQ is racing to become a major player in quantum computing. Palantirs builds customer AI software applications for government and commercial applications. The company is highly profitable and its growth has accelerated since the summer of 2023. The stock's current price-to-sales ratio (80) and forward price to earnings ratio (167) are egregious.

articles.title: As AI Demand Rises, So Do Power-Thirsty Data Centers
articles.summary: There are more than 3,600 data centers in the U.S. and 80% of them are concentrated in 15 states. The market for data centers has doubled since 2020. Tech companies that require large amounts of computing power, the private equity firms and banks that invest in them and other real estate or specialized firms are the primary funders of data centers. Data centers use a lot of energy, water and other resources.

articles.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.summary: ChatGPT, OpenAI's text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. It has 300 million weekly active users. OpenAI will discontinue its largest AI model, GPT-4.5, from its API on April 30. The company is developing its own social media platform to compete with Elon Musk's X and Mark Zuckerberg's Instagram and Threads.

articles.title: HitPaw Online Launches its AI Video Generator for Effortless Creation
articles.author: Hit Paw
articles.summary: HitPaw Online has launched a new AI Video Generator on its website. The tool is powered by advanced AI models and interprets user input to generate high-quality, dynamic videos. Text to Video allows you to create fully videos by entering a text prompt. Image to Video gives static images new meaning through motion.

articles.title: HitPaw Online Launches its AI Video Generator for Effortless Creation
articles.author: Doris Hansen
articles.summary: HitPaw has announced the launch of its brand-new AI Video Generator on HitPaw Online. Powered by advanced AI models, the tool intelligently interprets user input to generate high-quality, dynamic videos. The Text to Video feature allows you to create fully videos by entering a detailed text prompt. Image to Video gives static images new meaning through motion.

articles.title: HitPaw Online Launches its AI Video Generator for Effortless Creation
articles.author: Hit Paw
articles.summary: The tool is powered by advanced AI models. It interprets user input to generate high-quality, dynamic videos that suit a variety of needs. The tool is available in English and Spanish. It's free and available in both English and in Spanish.

articles.title: HitPaw Online Launches its AI Video Generator for Effortless Creation
articles.author: Hit Paw
articles.summary: The tool is powered by advanced AI models. It interprets user input to generate high-quality, dynamic videos that suit a variety of needs. The tool is available in English and Spanish. It's free and available in both English and in Spanish.

articles.title: HitPaw Online Launches its AI Video Generator for Effortless Creation
articles.summary: HitPaw Online has launched a new AI Video Generator on its website. The tool is powered by advanced AI models. Text to Video and Image to Video make it easier than ever to bring ideas to life. HitPaw has a mission to make digital content creation accessible to everyone.

articles.title: From â€˜catch up' to â€˜catch us': How Google quietly took the lead in enterprise AI
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: A year ago, Google seemed to be lagging behind in the enterprise AI field, but it's now on the upswing. It's the result of intense, focused execution, translating its technological assets into a performant, integrated platform that's rapidly winning over enterprise decision-makers.

articles.title: HC judge: AI can reduce pendency of cases
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) can be used to reduce the time and pendency of matters, according to Justice Somasekhar Sundaresan of the Bombay High Court on Friday. He said AI could be a powerful tool for expeditious and efficient justice delivery.

articles.title: Scout AI Raises $15m For AI Command And Control
articles.author: Garrett Reim
articles.summary: Scout AI has raised $15 million to further develop its vision-language-action artificial intelligence (AI) model, dubbed Fury. The startup says its system is intended to enable human operators to command fleets of military robots, including UAVs and autonomous ground and maritime vehicles.

articles.title: Best AI Website Builder: Tried and Tested
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: We've tested top AI website builders to help you find the best tool for creating your website without code and in just a few minutes of your time. We've tested some of the best AI websites builders and found the best one for you here.

articles.title: Business leaders consider the expanding role of AI at Publisher's Dinner
articles.author: Business Journal
articles.summary: AI has been the hot-button technology of the past two years. Business leaders have taken notice of it worldwide and especially here in Atlanta. Four local businesses have already started using AI.   Ã‚   for their own business development and development.

articles.title: TikTok erupts as ChatGPT casts doubt on Donald Trump's 215-pound claim, says reported weight and ...
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: A ChatGPT analysis of Donald Trump's reported physical data has stirred online buzz. The AI claimed Trump's stats, like weight and body mass index, are accurate, according to the chatgpt's analysis. The data is based on Trump's physical data.

articles.title: Report: Generation Beta to comprise 18% of global population by 2050
articles.author: Janae Bowens
articles.summary: Generation Beta will grow up with artificial intelligence integrated into various aspects of life, from healthcare to education. They will experience self-driving cars and virtual immersive experiences as part of their daily lives. Online gaming and consumer electronics will replace traditional toys, according to the BBC.

articles.title: Forget Bixby â€” Perplexity could soon come to your Samsung phone
articles.author: Amanda Caswell
articles.summary: Perplexity AI will bring its AI assistant to the upcoming Razr foldable phone. Perplexity is also in talks with Samsung to integrate its AI into Galaxy smartphones.  AI assistants are becoming more and more useful.    If Motorola's launch goes through, it could signal the start of a new wave of smartphones that integrate with AI.

articles.title: Cognitive Computing: Revolutionizing Industries
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Cognitive computing is an interdisciplinary field that uses AI, ML, and natural language processing (NLP) to create systems that can analyze complex data, solve problems, and make decisions with minimal human intervention. The technology is already making inroads in healthcare, finance, retail, and manufacturing. Big data analytics is instrumental in driving the adoption of cognitive computing solutions. North America is the largest regional market for cognitive computing. Asia-Pacific is the fastest-growing market.

articles.title: Was ChatGPT the Worst Thing to Happen to OpenAI?
articles.summary: Charlie Warzel and Damon Beres discuss the possibility of OpenAI launching a social network. The company is trying to build an advanced superintelligence known as AGI. It is also trying to figure out ways to use AI technology to improve the user interface of ChatGPT.

articles.title: The AI revolution: ending droughts, one algorithm at a time
articles.author: Christopher Mcfadden
articles.summary: Ayoade started his career as a physics and electronics engineer, moved into broadcast engineering, and then into software development. Since 2015, he has been deeply involved in AI, moving from software development to data analytics and eventually mastering AI-driven solutions. Ayoade believes AI could be the key to a long-term solution to drought.

articles.title: TemPolor's AI Technology: A Game Changer for the Music Industry
articles.author: Jon Stojan
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is reshaping how compositions are created, produced, and distributed. TemPolor is at the forefront of this shift with its proprietary AI model. Independent musicians have tools that allow them to create studio-quality music without large production budgets. Even major record labels and publishers are paying close attention to AI's ability to optimize licensing models.

articles.title: Was ChatGPT the Worst Thing to Happen to OpenAI?
articles.author: Damon Beres
articles.summary: The Verge reports that OpenAI is developing a social network to compete with Meta and X. Charlie Warzel and Damon Beres question the company's motives behind the idea. Charlie believes OpenAI's focus on for-profit business model may be a ploy to get more data for training its AI products.

articles.title: What to know about Venice's tourist tax
articles.summary: AP's Colleen Barry explains what to know about the AP's investigation into the death of a former president.   Â   Ã‚   .   in the video below.  In the video, Colleen explains what it is and what to do.

articles.title: What Does the Future Hold for Us?
articles.author: Tarah Buchan
articles.summary: The rise of artificial intelligence, smart cities, renewable energy sources, digital currencies and the shift toward cashless economies are some of the trends that are changing the way we live, work and interact in the future. Space exploration is advancing rapidly, and private space tourism might be a reality in the near future.

articles.title: WATCH: A Turf Tank robot paints the batters' boxes at Illini Bluffs High School
articles.summary: Illini Bluffs High School has a Turf Tank robot that paints the field markings for several sports at the high school's request.    - provided by Steve Schafer of Illini Bluff's High School.  - supplied by the school's website.

articles.title: End of Fragmented Automation
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Archyde News Editor is interviewing Dr. Aris Thorne, chief AI Strategist at NovaTech Solutions, about AI fragmentation in business. Dr. Thorne advises businesses to focus on the long-term benefits of AI, consolidate AI tools and create a Center of Excellence.

articles.title: Montgomery County Launches AI Advisory Council to Enhance Public
articles.author: Source
articles.summary: Montgomery County is launching a new Advisory Council on Artificial Intelligence for Public Good. The county is forming a council of 7-15 experts from various sectors, such as private industry, academia, public service, and nonprofits. This council will work with an internal group of county employees to implement Artificial Intelligence with transparency and accountability.

articles.title: Can AI find you love? We put ChatGPT to the test with some Columbus locals
articles.author: Sundi Rose
articles.summary: According to a survey, 62% of singles would swipe right on an AI-generated dating profile. The University of New South Wales at Sydney reports that 43% of respondents said the profiles looked real. In the experiment, AI created a profile for David, 57, who is looking for a woman who values honesty, lives with intention, and doesn't want children.

articles.title: Thesys Introduces C1 to Launch the Era of Generative UI
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: C1 by Thesys is the world's first API built for Generative User Interface (GenUI). It allows developers to turn LLM outputs into live, dynamic applications in real time. It marks a significant breakthrough in how AI-powered interfaces are designed and deployed.

articles.title: OpenAI's latest AI models can â€˜think with images' and combine tools
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: OpenAI has released their newest AI models: o3 and o4-mini. They are the company's smartest and most capable models to date. They're their first reasoning models that can also reason when it comes to complex problems. The company's blog post about them says that they are their "smartest, most capable and reasoning AI models".

articles.title: Pitt gets $10 million to expand artificial intelligence in medicine
articles.author: Kris B. Mamula
articles.summary: Pitt and Leidos Inc. are expanding their partnership with a $10 million investment to use artificial intelligence to improve medical care for patients and generate revenue for the university. The deal comes as the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services has been cutting research funding for universities, including Pitt, Carnegie Mellon and Duquesne.

articles.title: The future of transportation? Self-driving bus debuts in downtown West Palm Beach
articles.author: Chris Persaud
articles.summary: Guident, a Boca Raton-based tech company, launched a self-driving, electric minibus service in downtown West Palm Beach. The minibus follows a 1-mile route connecting the Brightline station and a parking garage, operating at 5 mph and braking for cars and pedestrians. A human operator is currently required onboard for safety, using a video game controller for manual steering when needed. Guident plans to expand the service to Boca raton later this year.

articles.title: Journalism in the age of deepfakes: Insights from the Central Asian Media Forum
articles.author: Galiya Khassenkhanova
articles.summary: The Central Asian Media Forum was held in Astana, Kazakhstan. Media professionals, tech experts and government officials discussed the region's growing prominence on the global landscape. The forum addressed the problem of the spreading of false information. It also discussed the benefits and opportunities AI brings.

articles.title: OpenAI's New AI Models o3 and o4-mini Can Now 'Think With Images'
articles.author: Aminu Abdullahi
articles.summary: OpenAI has rolled out two new AI models, o3 and o4â€‘mini. They can reason about images the same way they do about text. They are available to ChatGPT Plus, Pro, and Team users as of April 16. Enterprise and education users will get access next week.

articles.title: ChatGPT will now use its 'memory' to personalize web searches
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.summary: OpenAI upgraded ChatGPT's "memory" feature to let it draw on past conversations to inform queries when the bot searches the web. It's not clear which users have it yet, but some accounts on X report they began seeing it earlier this week.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence to help Lower Burrell public works save money, plan road repairs
articles.author: Kellen Stepler
articles.summary: Lower Burrell council approved a five-year agreement with Vialytics at a cost of $11,520 annually plus a set-up fee of $2,875. The city will get the equipment in May and begin to train its public works crew to use it in June. The technology can identify 15 types of road damage and problems with traffic signs, manhole covers and other issues.

articles.title: The Denver Post's AI policy ðŸ¤–
articles.author: Corey Hutchins
articles.summary: The Denver Post has a policy on using artificial intelligence in local newsrooms. It requires human review of content produced with AI assistance to ensure it is accurate and meets professional standards. It also requires that any use of AI to create text for publication must be approved by a supervisor and disclosed to readers.

articles.title: The â€˜future will belong to journalists,' says AI that wrote an entire Italian newspaper for a month
articles.author: Anna Desmarais
articles.summary: Il Foglio newspaper in Italy used an AI chatbot to write all of its content for a month. It published over 22 articles with the first page dedicated to the news, cultural topics, opinion and debate pieces stimulated by the AI. The last page was politics, economics, and letters to the editor with the AI's answers. The AI will continue to be published once a week and will be integrated elsewhere in the newspaper.

articles.title: Cato Networks
articles.author: Luismario Rivera
articles.summary: ChatGPT, DeepSeek and Microsoft Copilot are Generative AI tools. Recently, ChatGPT rolled out a new image generation tool that is exploding in popularity. In a recent test, a researcher tricked popular GenAI tools into developing malware capable of stealing passwords from Google Chrome.

articles.title: Message to Trump: Russia's Victory Over Ukraine is Non-Negotinable
articles.author: Alexander Dugin
articles.summary: AI Alexander Dugin explains to Trump what he needs to understand if he's serious about easing tensions with Russia and stopping World War 3.    i.e. if he wants to stop tensions and stop WW3.  i   in Russian.

articles.title: MSOE looks to become AI education leader through new campaign
articles.summary: Milwaukee School of Engineering's Next Bold Step campaign has a fundraising goal of $125 million. The goal is to build a stronger program and facility to use AI 'to help solve the technical challenges of the 21st century' Ben Paulson is the president of the AI Club at MSOE. His project uses AI to help the U.N. Food and Agriculture Organization detect food price increases around the world. Olga Imas, professor of biomedical engineering, believes students should have access to the latest advancements in the classroom.

articles.title: AI vs. automation: How to leverage each for maximum impact
articles.author: Aytekin Tank
articles.summary: At Jotform, we offer both automation and AI solutions to our users. The real power comes in knowing when to use which technology. Automation is ideal for repetitive tasks and AI agents for dynamic responses to dynamic situations. Jot form offers both to its users.

articles.title: Agentic AI Raises Serious Security and Privacy Concerns
articles.author: Dan Mitchell
articles.summary: Agentic AI is artificial intelligence capable of making autonomous decisions without human intervention. Experts warn that such autonomy could lead to unpredictable behaviors, security vulnerabilities, and ethical concerns. Researchers at MIT stress that without strict oversight, these systems could make harmful decisions, intentionally or not.

articles.title: Franklin County Chamber of Commerce breakfast explores AI
articles.summary: Franklin County Chamber of Commerce held an AIming for the Future Chamber Breakfast on Friday. The breakfast featured speakers from the GCC Artificial Intelligence Innovators Club and Thomas Bernardin, the keynote speaker from the Center for Data Science and Artificial Intelligence at the University of Massachusetts Amherst.

articles.title: Meta Blocks Apple Intelligence Features on Facebook, Instagram, Threads
articles.summary: Meta has blocked Apple's Writing Tools and Genmoji features on its iOS apps. Apple and Meta had a deal for Llama AI chatbot, but it was called off last year. Facebook, Instagram, Threads, Messenger, and WhatsApp already have AI chatbots. Google's Gemini may be next.

articles.title: The Five AI Use Cases Every Company Needs To Know
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Getting AI to work for you is not going to take moving heaven and earth, but it's possible to get it to do it for you if you have the right attitude and the right motivation.   Ã‚. Ã‚   y   in

articles.title: A Chatbot Has Passed a Critical Test For Human-Like Intelligence. Now What?
articles.author: Zena Assad
articles.summary: There have been several headlines about an AI chatbot passing the Turing test. However, there is disagreement about the validity of this test. Beege Welborn suggests to kill the study with fire and focus on the real significance of the subject.   Â

articles.title: Are Pilots Worried About AI Taking Their Jobs?
articles.author: Simple Flying
articles.summary: is an artificial intelligence (AI) that can be controlled by a human mind. It can be programmed by an intelligent intelligence ( AI) could replace human mind as an intelligent mind (human mind (AI). AI can control human mind, but not fully controlled by human mind ( AI).

articles.title: Cloud AI Update - AI Security Innovation: Operant AI Unveils AI Gatekeeper
articles.author: Simply Wall St
articles.summary: Operant AI has unveiled its new product, AI Gatekeeper, which aims to enhance runtime protection for AI applications and agents across various deployment platforms, including Kubernetes and hybrid and private clouds. Snowflake's rapid AI-driven product expansion and strategic tech partnerships are amplifying its market influence. Microsoft enhanced its cloud-based AI capabilities with integrations like Visier's workforce AI assistant and secured a significant contract for carbon removal with AtmosClear.

articles.title: Building brand trust in the age of AI: Why human connection still matters
articles.author: Maria Alonso
articles.summary: Brands compete on trust. Consumers are skeptical of institutions, businesses, and the marketing messages they encounter daily. Ben & Jerry's has a long-standing commitment to climate action, racial justice, and corporate responsibility. They actively fund initiatives, support advocacy efforts and educate consumers.

articles.title: You can tell Google's latest AI to stop thinking so much
articles.summary: Developers can stop Google Gemini 2.5 Flash from thinking. The new feature aims to address the intense processing and computing requirements of a new wave of 'reasoning' models. It follows the shift in the industry to become more 'efficient' in the use of computing power.

articles.title: How quantum could supercharge Google's AI ambitions
articles.author: Jasmine Wu
articles.summary: Scientists at Alphabet are working on developing the world's most advanced quantum computers in Santa Barbara, California. Google unveiled a quantum computing chip called Willow last year, which it says can solve a benchmark problem unimaginably faster than what's possible with a classical computer. Google has been viewed by many as late to the generative AI boom, because OpenAI broke into the mainstream first with ChatGPT in late 2022.

articles.title: Big tech is going nuclear. Could Diablo Canyon be used to power AI in SLO County?
articles.author: Chloe Shrager
articles.summary: ChatGPT and Google's Gemini chatbots use a lot of energy. Big Tech companies are investing heavily in clean energy. Microsoft signed a 20-year power purchase deal that will reopen one of the nuclear reactors at Three Mile Island in Pennsylvania. Amazon and Google both announced nuclear energy agreements with companies that design small modular reactors based in California. California has at least 310 data centers for AI and other technologies. PG&E's Diablo Canyon nuclear power plant generates about 2,200 megawatts of energy each year, accounting for 8.5% of the state's power.

articles.title: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin flop is bigger than Katy Perry
articles.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
articles.summary: Microsoft is updating Copilot as it marks its 50th anniversary. New features bring it in line with other AI systems like ChatGPT or Claude. Copilot Vision can analyze real-time video from a mobile camera and Copilot can use the web on your behalf.

articles.title: You can tell Google's latest AI to stop thinking so much
articles.author: Hasan Chowdhury
articles.summary: Google has just upgraded its AI model, Gemini 2.5 Flash, with a new feature that allows developers to set a "thinking budget" to calibrate how much thinking Google's AI model does for any task. The new feature aims to address the intense processing and computing requirements of a new wave of AI models.

articles.title: Bill Gates Says His Kids And Grandkids Will Live In A 'Very Changed World' As AI Puts An End To Shortage Of Teachers And Doctors
articles.author: Shomik Sen Bhattacharjee
articles.summary: Bill Gates says artificial intelligence will soon wipe out chronic shortages of skilled workers like doctors and teachers. He believes society will have to rethink the value of time and the concept of 'work hours' within the next two decades. His kids and grandkids will live in a changed world.

articles.title: Can OpenAI make generative AI more social? Can anyone?
articles.author: Harry McCracken
articles.summary: Sam Altman wants to build a social network around ChatGPT. Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, acquired his social network, Twitter X, for $45 billion. AI's impact on Facebook has been to junk up feeds with spam posts and pointless interjections.

articles.title: Kraft Group inks big IT contract to use AI at Gillette Stadium and across its businesses
articles.summary: The Kraft Group is a high-profile customer for NWN's artificial intelligence technology. The company cleared about $1 billion in sales last year. Robert Kraft and son Jonathan Kraft are pushing the Kraft Group to be more creative and entrepreneurial. The new contract comes as the company is building a new football practice facility in Foxborough and preparing to put up a soccer stadium in Everett.

articles.title: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI): What It Means & How It Will Impact Us
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) is defined as AI that matches human intelligence across a wide range of tasks. The term "artificial intelligence" was coined at the Dartmouth Workshop in 1956. In 1970, Marvin Minsky predicted that within 3 to 8 years, a machine with the general intelligence of an average human being would be able to read Shakespeare, grease a car, play office politics, tell a joke and have a fight.

articles.title: Humanoid robots are coming to a warehouse near you
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Agility's Digit robot works inside a warehouse. Amazon and GXO are already testing humanoid robots in their warehouses. Humanoids are easier to control than robots that look and move like humans, so they can be used in factories and warehouses more easily.

articles.title: Italian newspaper gives free rein to AI, admires its irony
articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.summary: Il Foglio put out a four-page daily insert for one month that was written entirely by AI. The trial was a big success and boosted sales, editor Claudio Cerasa said. He will now publish a separate section once a week written by AI in a conservative newspaper with 22 staffers.

articles.title: JetBrains IDEs now include AI tools by subscription
articles.author: Info World
articles.summary: JetBrains AI tools are now available with a single subscription and with a free tier for JetBrains IDEs. The new AI tools include the improved AI Assistant tool and coding agent dubbed Junie and the AI Assistant is available with the single subscription.

articles.title: Is AI reliable in managing chronic diseases? Experts weigh in
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Experts claim that artificial intelligence has begun to reshape the management of chronic diseases, but questions remain about its reliability and long-term effectiveness. AI systems show promise in tracking health data and identifying trends, but treatment decisions still require a doctor's experience, especially in complex cases.

articles.title: Forget the Correction: 2 Artificial Intelligence Stocks That Are Still Worth Buying Anyway
articles.author: Stefon Walters
articles.summary: It hasn't been the best start to 2025 for many U.S. stock market indexes and top tech companies. Despite the current correction, there are two artificial intelligence (AI) stocks that are worth loading up on: Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG) and CrowdStrike (NASADA: CRWD).

articles.title: Why am I paying taxes when Donald Trump is gutting the government?
articles.author: Detroit Free Press
articles.summary: Linda McMahon mistakenly called AI "A.1". Ken Tomkevicius and Suzy Milenkovich are critical of the use of AI in education. They are also critical of Trump's cuts to Social Security, EPA and other government services.

articles.title: Can this $70,000 robot transform AI research?
articles.author: Kurt Knutsson
articles.summary: Hugging Face has acquired Pollen Robotics, which makes state-of-the-art humanoid robot Reachy 2. The robot is open-source and VR-compatible, perfect for research, education and experimenting with embodied AI. It costs $70,000. Hugging Face is making moves to make robotics more accessible.

articles.title: The CEO of Uber says not enough of his employees know how to use AI: â€˜Absolute necessity' within a year
articles.summary: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi wants to teach employees how to use artificial intelligence. Shopify CEO Tobi LÃ¼tke wants to make AI usage a baseline expectation at his company. Mark Zuckerberg expects his company to have AI in place within a year.

articles.title: JuicyChat.AI Redefines NSFW AI Anime Ecosystem, Closes Loop for Creators
articles.author: Juicy Chat.AI
articles.summary: JuicyChat.AI is redefining the landscape of NSFW AI-powered anime content with a groundbreaking ecosystem that prioritizes the needs of its creators. JuicyChat is launching a series of tools, programs and community initiatives to support and empower its creators worldwide.

articles.title: JuicyChat.AI Redefines NSFW AI Anime Ecosystem, Closes Loop for Creators
articles.author: Juicy Chat.AI
articles.summary: JuicyChat.AI is redefining the landscape of NSFW AI-powered anime content with a groundbreaking ecosystem that prioritizes its creators and their core needs. The platform is launching a series of tools, programs, and community initiatives to support and empower its creators. Official Creator Certification is now live.

articles.title: Stock-Split Watch: Is SoundHound AI Next?
articles.author: Ryan Vanzo
articles.summary: SoundHound AI (NASDAQ: SOUN) has attracted the attention of many investors. Nvidia briefly invested several million dollars into the company. SoundHound might conduct a reverse stock split in 2025. The Motley Fool Stock Advisor analyst team just revealed what they believe are the 10 best stocks to buy right now.

articles.title: Why are AI companies so bad at naming their models?
articles.author: Henry Chandonnet
articles.summary: OpenAI launched GPT-4.1. Sam Altman apologizes for the name of the AI model. AI companies have a branding problem of their own creation. Google named its chatbot Gemini. Meta named their Large Language Model Meta AI family Llama.

articles.summary: China's Ministry of Industry and Information Technology and the Ministry of Finance have jointly established a 60 billion yuan ($8.2 billion) national artificial intelligence fund to fast-track strategic investments in AI infrastructure and cutting-edge technologies. China's systematic approach positions it to dominate not just AI application but also foundational innovation.

articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Agentic AI is reshaping security operations by reducing alert fatigue and enabling faster threat response. It's ushering in a new era of autonomous, transparent SOCs, says the company's CEO, Tom Veronika Kostenkova.

articles.author: Digital Trends
articles.summary: Kagi lets you search and chat with all of the things you want to talk to. It's free and available on Android and iOS. It also has built-in features for voice chat and photo sharing. It can be used for business purposes only.

articles.author: Daily Sabah
articles.summary: The artificial intelligence agent market is predicted to grow from $5.1 billion in 2024 to $47 billion by 2030, according to a report by Forrester. It is expected to grow at a CAGR of 50% between 2024 and 2030.

articles.title: Man launches New Forest model exhibition for Alzheimer
articles.author: BBC News
articles.summary: Michael McCabe's wife was diagnosed with Alzheimer's. He would like to see the world rid of this disease. He has created Around the World in 80 Models, a display of all his model buildings he made while spending time with his wife after she was diagnosed.

articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: Seminar on "Journalism and Artificial Intelligence" was held at the Multan Press Club to impart awareness about use of AI tools in media for effective and speedy flow of accurate information. UrduPoint and Pakistan Point News jointly sponsored the seminar.

articles.author: Hindustan Times

articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence can play a pivotal role in improving the basics of good business, according to Mr. Kannemann. He believes that it can help improve the business practices of the company. He also believes it can improve the quality of the business.

articles.title: You can tell Google's latest AI to stop thinking so much
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Google has upgraded its AI model, Gemini 2.5 Flash. Developers can now calibrate how much thinking Google's Gemini model does for any task. Google has also rolled out an option to turn thinking on or off for developers. It's not yet clear if it will be available to all developers.

Unlike traditional chatbots, these advanced AI agents engage in natural behaviour and create a more compassionate and effective patient experience.

articles.title: How legal sector enters new era with AI adoption
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: The legal sector is witnessing a shift with the introduction of artificial intelligence tools aimed at improving efficiency and reducing case backlogs. AI integration can support lawyers by automating repetitive work, allowing them to focus on case strategy and client interaction. AI tools can reduce time spent on legal research and improve access to information.

articles.title: Integrating AI into education system discussed
articles.author: The News International
articles.summary: A significant meeting was held at the office of the Parliamentary Secretary for Education here on Thursday to deliberate on Pakistan's future direction in the fields of education and artificial intelligence. The initiative, proposed under the Ministry of Federal Education, aims to equip Pakistani students with the skills necessary to thrive in a rapidly evolving global tech landscape.

articles.title: What the most stereotypical mothers from cities around the UK look like, according to AI... ...
articles.author: The Daily Mail

One viewer dubbed the predictions 'scarily accurate'   Â on the Instagram account. The generator predicted what the average mother might look like in different UK cities.

articles.title: Crunchyroll president says the anime streaming site is 'not considering' using AI in any way ...
articles.author: Games Radar
articles.summary: President of Crunchyroll Rahul Purini says the site will not use AI in any way during the creative process of making content. He considers voice actors to be creators because they contribute to the story and plot with their voice and they are not considered AI creators.

articles.summary: Kompact AI is a joint venture between IIT Madras and Bengaluru-based startup Ziroh Labs. It claims to have a breakthrough in artificial intelligence by enabling large language models to operate efficiently on central processing units rather than the traditionally used graphics processing units.

articles.title: Watch: AI drone beats human pilot in Abu Dhabi's $1 million prize pool autonomous race
articles.author: Gulf News
articles.summary: An AI-powered drone has outpaced human pilots in a global competition held in Abu Dhabi. The Abu Dhabi Autonomous Racing League (A2RL), a project under the Advanced Advanced Research Projects Agency (ARPA), won three top titles in the competition.

articles.title: Avoid Development Purgatory: How To Unblock AI Projects And Accelerate Innovation
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: The future of AI isn't about who has the boldest ideas but who can execute and scale them safely. Will your company be one of them? If so, will it be able to compete with the big names in AI? If not, it won't.

articles.title: It's a confusing mess to compare the alphabet soup of AI models
articles.author: system
articles.summary: It's getting harder to compare AI models. Tech companies often use "benchmarks" to measure how an AI model performs. Industry observers are becoming increasingly wary of benchmark reliability. Meta's interpretation of their policy did not match what they expect from model providers.

articles.title: IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw showcases indigenous AI server 'Adipoli'
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: AI server 'Adipoli' is equipped with 8 GPUs and was completely designed in India, underlining the country's contribution to the development of AI technology in India. It was built by a company based in India and equipped with eight GPUs.

articles.title: Google's AI Overviews echo anti-abortion messaging, report finds
articles.author: The Star
articles.summary: Google's AI summaries have responded to some internet searches about abortion by responding to them with their own summaries. Google's AI has responded to the searches with the summaries provided by AI. Google has not confirmed the existence of the replies yet.

articles.title: Beyond AI: What We Can Expect From AGI
articles.author: Eli Amdur
articles.summary: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) is a type of AI that can understand, learn, and apply intelligence at a level comparable to human cognition. AGI could revolutionize science, medicine, engineering, manufacturing, transportation, mining, counterterrorism, and more. It currently takes as much as 10-12 years of R&D to bring a new drug to market, but AGI can do it in a matter of days.

articles.title: AI Can Reshape Enterprisesâ€”But The Need For Human Involvement Remains
articles.summary: Prithvi Shergill is a partner at entomo getty. She believes that organizations that integrate AI into their strategic and operational priorities gain a significant competitive advantage. AI should be deeply embedded in enterprise mindsets and methods rather than treated as a standalone technology.

articles.title: How AI Is Evolving And What It Means For Investors Today
articles.summary: Dmitrii Khasanov is an angel investor, digital marketing expert and founder of Arrow Stars. He has invested in a variety of projects, from analytics platforms for retail to AI-powered call center solutions. AI is no longer just a tool for corporate efficiency or personal convenience, it has captured the attention of financial institutions and government regulators.

articles.title: Why Gen Z Craves The Freedom To Make Mistakes At Work
articles.author: Colleen Batchelder
articles.summary: Gen Z want the freedom to make mistakes at work. They don't have the privilege of trying to outshine their peers for recognition. Many managers would rather invest in robotics than in Gen Z employees. AI is the only measure of success for Gen Z. It's important to integrate AI into the workplace.

articles.title: The Real ROI In Healthcare Tech? Return On Influence
articles.author: James Lindsey
articles.summary: James Lindsey is the IT Strategy and Innovation Principal at Texas Oncology. He reframed the concept of ROI to focus on 'return on influence' rather than on the amount of money spent on technology. It's not about tracking money right away, it's about measuring momentum, understanding how innovation reduces diagnostic guesswork and trusting the long-term impacts.
